# Coin Swarm (Spell)
## Overview
[[Conjuration Spells|Conjuration]] ([[Summoning Spells|summoning]])

**Level:** [[5th Level Druid Spells|Druid 5]], [[5th Level Shaman Spells|Shaman 5]], [[4th Level Sorcerer Spells|Sorcerer 4]], [[3rd Level Summoner Spells|Summoner 3]], [[5th Level Witch Spells|Witch 5]], [[4th Level Wizard Spells|Wizard 4]]

**BoXM:** [[BoXM 9th-Level Druid Spells List|Druid 9]], [[BoXM 7th-Level Wizard Spells List|Wizard 7]]

**Casting Time:** 1 standard action

**Components:** V, S, M (1,000 or more coins)

**Range:** Medium (50 ft. + 10 ft./4 levels)

**Effect:** One swarm of flying coins

**Duration:** Concentration + 2 rounds

**Saving Throw:** None

**Spell Resistance:** No

**Source:** Deep Magic (Kobold Press), pg. 145

This devastating spell turns any pile of 1,000 coins or more into a swarm of flying shards of metal with a fly speed of 30 ft. per round. The swarm is under the mental command of the caster as long as he or she concentrates, and it deals 1d6 hp damage for every 4 caster levels of the spellcaster. The damage is treated as magical for the purposes of penetrating damage resistance.

If the pile contains any coins of unusual metals, such as [[Iron, Cold|cold iron]], [[Mithral|mithral]], or adamantium, the swarm can penetrate the relevant damage resistance. Otherwise treat as a standard *[[Summon Swarm (Spell)|summon swarm]]* spell, and the swarm follows the rules for the [[S3.3 - Creature Subtypes (Bestiary 6 Apx)|swarm subtype]] in the Pathfinder Bestiary.
